column4: displayName
Container Metadata
description
The platform in which the container was ran e.g., Docker or Singularity.
The version of containerization platform.
This indicates the services need to run in case of Docker Compose.
This indicates the process of associating a port on the host machine with a port on the container.
The port on the container that is exposed.
The port on the host that is exposed.
The network protocol used for the port mapping.
This indicates the rules for inbound and outbound network traffic of the container.
This indicates how the container communicates with the network,.
The IP addresses associated with the container.
This specifies hostname of the container which is container's id by default.
This indicates any mounting associated with the container.
This determines how file systems are shared between the host and the container.
This indicates the path to the file or directory on the host machine.
This indicates the path where the file or directory is mounted in the container.
This indicates the user is assigned to this container.
Name of the user.
Id of the user.
This indicates a group in which a user belongs to.
Name of the group.
Id of the group.
This indicates the list of the environment variables used in this container.
Name of the environment variable.
Value of the correspondinng environment variable.
This indicates the entrypoint or runscript intructions to this container.
This denotes the quantity of resources allocated to the container.
This indicates the minimum required number of CPUs / virtual CPUs / cores.
This indicates memory requirements with a tb, gb, mb, or kb suffix.
This specifies the details of the image on which the container was built.
This specifies the platform in which the image was built.
Is the image available as a tarball or as a image in a image registry?
Specify a url of the image location.
identifier
